alert.note: Alert for Navajo (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 26 at 5:01PM MST until August 26 at 6:15PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Navajo County in north central Arizona... * Until 615 PM MST. * At 500 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area earlier today. Heavy rain has now ended Between 0.75 and 1.5 inches of rain have fall earlier today. Flash flooding is likely ongoing. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Hard Rock, Hopi Reservation, Navajo Reservation, Kykotsmovi Village and Hotevilla. This includes the following highways... State Route 264 between mile markers 363 and 367...and between mile markers 372 and 375. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Burnt Corn Wash, Dinnebito Wash, Oraibi Wash, Polacca Wash and Wepo Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly or mountainous terrain, there are many low water crossings which will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
